result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Allen White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

F.T.

Defendant Richard Allen White in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant Richard Allen White in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In small courtroom outside the presence of the jury.  Court questions DE as to his plea.  DE entered an alford plea.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea ot amended charge 948.04 - court is satisfied the DE has freely entered his plea and finds the defendant guilty.   State addressed the Court.  Atty Reid addressed the Court.   court 15 minute recess to excuse jury.

11:48 AM  Back on the record in the large courtroom after jury was excused
  Court ordered the state to file a second amended information as to the amended count and deleting the balance of counts.  State ready to proceed today.  Atty Reid wishes to proceed today.   F.T. addressed the Court.  Court apologized to F.T. for the delays today.  State makes arguement.  Atty Reid argues sentencing.  Defendant addressed the Court.    F.T. further addressed the Court.   State further addressed the Court.  Court addressed F.T. offered words of encouragement.  Court addressed the defendant.  DE addressed the Court.  Court makes further stmt.  F.T. further addressed the Court.  Court addressed her.  

COURT:   Sentenced to in prison  2478 days (3.7 years) confinement 1383 days as time served  - 1095 days of ES (3 years) - no contact with F.T. or her family no contact directly, indirectly or a 3rd party with the exception of an attorney and no electronic contact - seek appropriate mental health treatment DOC to assist him get the treatment - continue the re-entry program - If F.T. obtains any costs as to treatment DE to re-imburse those costs - costs - not eligible for challenge and not eligible for substance abuse

Page 2  pretrial conference

Defendant Richard Allen White in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant Richard Allen White in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In small courtroom outside the presence of the jury.  Court addressed the DE as to the amended charge Causing Mental Harm to a child - 948.04.  DE does not understand the charge.  Court we are going to trial.  Atty Reid requests sequestration.  State addressed the Court.  Court makes stmt as to any reference to the term victim Defense does not want it to be allowed - state wishes to use alleged victim - Court reference should be alleged.  10:43 AM off the record  to begin in 10 minutes in large courtroom.  
10:50 AM  Back on the record outside the presence of the jury in the small courtroom - Court addressed the DE again as to the plea offer - DE addressed the Court thanks the court for taking the time with him - Court further addressed the DE - Court recites plea agreement again offer is to 948.04 Causing Mental Harm to a child - Court questions DE as to his plea - DE alford plea entered.

08:09 AM Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Outside the presence of the Jury in the small courtroom.  State recites appearances.  DE is not present at this time.  Atty Reid addressed the Court DE refused to see him last night, has rejected meeting with him and sends his mail correspondence back to the PD's office - DE is at the Courthouse at the jail last night the defendant stated he did not want to participate in his jury trial.  Atty Marcoux addressed the Court - 1 we can go thru the trial without him/ adjourn trial for lack of cooperation or have DE come in and renew his request on another atty.   Atty Reid makes further record wishes to make further record with the defendant.  Court addressed the attorney's requests Atty Reid go attempt to speak to his client w/o Mr. Maynard in the conference room if unwilling to talk to him return then we will bring the DE in the courtroom for the Judge to speak with him.  8:18 AM  Off the record
8:25 AM  back on the record - Atty Reid addressed the Court - spoke to his client DE does not want a trial - DE stated he wants an atty but one that is ready to go foward - Atty Reid stated he has met with the defendant previously and they have prepared for trial.   Court questions Atty Reid as to being prepared for today's trial.  Atty Reid states he is prepared to go forward today.  Court questions Atty Reid.  Atty Reid states he has represented the DE for about late last year.  Court finds Atty Reid is prepared to go forward - court requests DE to appear in the courtroom to question him.  8:30 AM  off the record to obtain Mr. White.
8:32 AM  Back on the record - DE appears in person in custody.  Atty Reid addressed the Court DE is now ready.  Court addressed the defendant advised him he is assigned to hear his case today and would like to ask him some questions case will go foward today and how it will go forward will depend on him and the atty's matter will go forward today as the matter needs to be resolved.  Court questions him on his thoughts on how he feels it should proceed today - request for not having Atty Reid represent him will be denied again by this court if he requests it today with explaination as to why and states Atty Reid is prepared to go forward today, no one else is as prepared as Atty Reid is to defend him.  DE addressed the Court he states Atty Reid has not gone over the case with him and has not collected any evidence or obtained files from other atty's.  Court advised him the trial will go forward today there needs to be closure.   DE addressed the Court further.  Court further addressed the DE there will be a trial unless there is an agreement this has been going on for over 4 years.  DE makes further stmt to the Court.   Court addressed the DE and Atty Reid has informed the Court of what he has done to prepare for the trial - Court believes the atty is prepared for the trial.  DE further addressed the Court.  Court addressed the defendant trial will proceed - attorneys are bound by a code of ethics they are not required to check things out that are not relevant to the case.  Court has gone thru this file including the letters he has written the charges are what he has alleged to have done not anyone else and what others have done in other cases has nothing to do with this case.  DE makes further stmt.  Court addressed the defendant further.    Court trial has nothing to do with anything prior to 7/4/2015 and recites charges.  DE makes further arguement.  Court addressed the defendant.  DE states he does not feel his atty is ready.  Court states he has already found Atty Reid is ready to go forward - questions DE as to if he is going to participate or not.  DE states he feels he has always been respectful.  Court said okay we are going to go forward today - Atty Reid will be speaking today for him not himself - he can consult with Atty Reid.  If he becomes disrespectful he will be removed from the courtroom.   9:00 AM  State addressed the Court - recites the offer that was made.  Court questions the state.  State makes further stmt.  Court makes stmt plead to count 2 or 3 is what the offer is state would recommend.   Atty Reid addressed the Court requests about 10 minutes to discuss plea with client and see what the DE would like to do.  9:07 AM  Off the record for Atty Reid to speak with his client.  10-:05 AM  Back on the record outside the presence of the Jury in the small courtroom - Court recites appearances make s stmt-   Atty Reid addressed the Court.  State recites possible agreement - state would move to amend count 2 948.04 causing mental harm to a child class F felony - 7 1/2 yrs prison and 4 1/2 years in custody creidt time served -  3 years ES.  Atty Reid addressed the court that is his understanding of the agreement - plea questionnaire has been completed.  Court questions DE as to if he will accept plea.  DE states he needs more time questions court as to a class F felony.  Court questions Atty Reid - and questions DE further.  DE states Atty Reid needs more time.  Court we will proceed to trial.  DE states he is still considering the plea offer.  Court advised the DE he can consider it but we are going to proceed to trial.   Court addressed both Atty's - previously read counts on amended info.  court needs a list of witnessess - State recites witnessess  - Atty Reid recites witnessess - Court will allow jury to take notes - State looking at 3 days maybe short of that but 3 days - Court 2 to 3 days - Court allows jurors to ask witnessess questions does the Atty's object?  Court asks atty's as to motions in limine.  Atty Reid approached the bench, DE signed plea agreement.   Court addressed the DE court is not bound by plea agreement does not have to do what either party is requesting he needs to make his own decission - court could reject the plea agreement court will not guarantee  10:25 AM  off the record   10:29 Am  Back on the record - court makes stmt - will proceed with pre-trial if DE at any time during the trial requests to take plea court will entertain it court will move forward.  State addressed the Court states if he begins voir dire and does opening stmt offer will be withdraw offer  Court makes further stmt as to voir dire.  State questions the court.  Court as far as strikes court will have 1 alternate atty's will have 5 strikes each.  No objection by either Atty.  State makes further stmt.  Court questions Atty Reid as to motions in limine.  Atty Reid has a completed plea questionnaire signed by the DE.  Court questions Atty Marcoux.
Jury Trail will be before Reserve Judge William Stewart. -AMA
JURY TRAIL WILL BE BEFORE A RESERVE JUDGE, RESERVE JUDGE TO BE DETERMINED.-AMA

Review on April 29, 2019 at 08:00 am.

08:31 AM Defendant Richard Allen White in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant Richard Allen White in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances - makes record as to competency hearing and the reports that have been filed conflicting reports so 4 Dr.'s will be appearing via phone today. Atty Reid addressed the Court as to documents filed on 4/4/19.   Court calls conference Bridge.  Court addressed all Dr.'s via phone  
8:34 AM Dr. Donna Minter appears via phone -  called by the State - sworn by the Court - examined by Atty Marcoux.  8:43 AM Cross-examined Atty Reid.  8:47 AM Re-direct Atty Marcoux.  8:48 AM Re-cross Atty Reid.  8:52 AM  Court excused witness - Dr. Minter has hung up. 
8:52 AM  Dr. Ana Garcia called appears via phone - sworn by the Court - examined Atty Marcoux.  9:16 AM  Cross-examined Atty Reid.  9:29 AM Re-direct Atty Marcoux.  State is requesting the Doctor remain on the line.      Court addressed Dr. Garcia.  Dr. remains on the line.
9:31 - Dr. Franco Peric called - sworn by the Court - examined Atty Marcoux   9:55 AM  Cross-examined Atty Reid  10:01 AM  Court questions witness  10:02 AM  Atty Reid continues  10:03 AM  Re-direct Attorney                     Marcoux   - State addressed court to take judicial notice to 4 reports - Court will take judicial notice
10:05 AM Dr. Gerald Henkel-Johnson called - sworn by the Court - examined by Atty Reid  10:16 AM Cross-examined Atty Marcoux  10:23 AM Atty Reid requests 2 reports court take judicail notice - court will take judicial      notice
10:24 AM  State recalls Dr. Garcia - Court reminds her she is still under oath - examined by Atty Marcoux 
10:27 AM Court excused all Doctor's they may hang up now
Court 5 minute recess 
10:33 AM  Back on the record - State makes arguement requests court find the DE competent      Court interjects and addressed Atty Marcoux    10:45 Atty Marcoux continues
10:47 AM  Atty Reid makes arguement requests court find defendant not competent    Court interjects and addressed Atty Reid     10:51 AM Atty Reid continues
10:53 AM  Court Finds the Defendant Competent to Stand Trial - Atty Reid will remain atty of record
11:06 AM  Off the record to schedule jury trial 3 1/2 days for jury  Review scheduled for April 29, 2019 at 08:00 am.
Benchbook Attachment
Competency hearing on April 15, 2019 at 08:30 am.

09:10 AM Defendant Richard Allen White in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant Richard Allen White in custody.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Time is set for competency hearing has been several stmts as to competency in the past have been made.  The Court has the evaluations by 2 Doctor's.   Atty Reid addressed the Court there is an evaluation and then an amended evaluation - amendment was to summary/conclussions and materials reviewed.  Court makes further stmt the one filed 3/13/19 states competent and the one on 3/27/19 is stating incompetent, 2 different doctor reports.  Court questions the defendant - Defendant stands mute court finds as defendant does not address the Court.  Atty Reid makes stmt defendant did not provide a response to him that was clear either.  Court makes stmt as to DE standing Mute.  State addressed the Court as to previous hearings and competency evaluations.  DE states Atty Reid is no longer his attorney.  Court provides copy of the report gives the state 10 minutes to review them.  State continues to address the Court their Doctor is not present they have been playing phone tag for 2 weeks  9:19 AM Recess for ADA to reveiw report.    9:27 AM  Back on the record.  Court addressed Atty marcoux after has read the evaluation.  Atty Marcoux - reviewed the 2nd report left with more questions then answers requests an adjournment State would like to seek a 3rd opinion.  Atty Reid addressed the Court.  Court recites the statute as to DE standing Mute - If defendant stands mute the court is to find him incompetent.  State addressed the Court further.  Court makes stmt DE can not fire Atty Reid without the Court's permission so court has not addressed this issue.  Mr. Reid remains on the case.  Court makes further stmt - Court is to find DE incompetent unless the State can prove he is competent by Statute.  Atty Reid further addressed the Court.  State makes further arguement.   Court addressed the State and Atty Reid.  State addressed the Court De was sent to Mendota to have an evaluation and they found him competent - if court finds him incompetent court is requesting he be committed for a period of 4 years.  Court addressed the State.  State makes further stmt.  Court makes further stmt as the report was filed on the 27th.  Atty Reid addressed the Court.  Court questions Atty Schmidt.  Court addressed the State 

 Court:  Waived requirement that the DR's appear in person the Dr's may appear via phone for the next hearing -  Competency hearing scheduled for April 15, 2019 at 08:30 am.
faxed to Wisconsin Forensic Unit and Wisconsin Community Services and emailed to vickif@wiforensicunit.com and aoldenburg@wisc.org w/complaint

03:31 PM Case called.  Defendant Richard Allen White in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses parties re letter sent to Judge Anderson, Atty Reid, Judge Yackel.  Also questions if on track for speedy trial.  Atty Reid responds re: letters.  Multiple conversations w/ADA Marcoux.  Have not had independent invaluation done-DE refused at one point.  DE would  like resolved, maintains innocence, doesn't want trial.  Atty Reid feels there are some competancy issues.  At this point, many attys have raised competency issue, while two reports have come back as competent.  Court addresses parties.  Atty Reid continues making record.  Atty Reid states DEF has made request for him to withdraw.  Also has conflict with trial date.  Court addresses DEF.  DEF states he wants trial off of the calendar.  Court lets DEF know that would extend time before next trial could be set and gives consequences, ie: more time spent in jail.  DEF wants trial canceled, not adjourned.  States he has several issues to go over w/Atty Reid.  Court addresses Atty Reid.  Atty Reid states they have found an independant evaluator to see DE.  Continued discussion.  Atty Reid states there are times when the DE can articulate and other times when he doesn't.  ADA Marcoux addresses court on issue as well.  Court agrees with lay evaluations.  Addresses parties. Court orders competency evaluation.  Court instructs Drs to be subpeoned for competency hearing.  Court addresses DE re competency exam.  Asks for explanation as to why DE wants to cancel trial of 4/10/19.  DEF states he would need to speak w/Atty Reed for reasons.  Discussion.  DE does not want jury trial.  ADA Marcoux addresses Court as to any offer(s) that have been given to DE.  Discussion.  Atty Reid states he has brought any and all plea offers advanced by the State to the DEF.
DEF states they have not discussed all options.  Atty Reid states he has explained all options to his client.  Court again addresses parties as to competency issues.  ADA Marcoux addresses Court.  Feels the problem may lie in the current standard for competance.  Discussion. Also a victim to consider.  Continued discussion re competency.  State doesn't see any additional harm in going forward with another competency exam, although puts case back to where it was months ago.  Atty Reed addresses Court re getting independant evaluation.  States there have been many ups and downs in status of client.  Court orders DE to comply with evaluation, if does not comply, will need to be transferred to a facility for its completion.  4:15 Off the record for scheduling.  4:18 PM On record- if Drs are saying DE is competent they are to be in Court to testify, if DE is found to be incompetent, the DRs may request to appear by phone.  State addresses parties.  If State feels Dr are not needed at hearing, he may submit letter.  Court cancels jury trial per repeated requests of DEF and scheduled competency evaluation.  Competency hearing scheduled for March 29, 2019 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard Allen White in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant Richard Allen White in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Reid addressed the Court states he does not have any concerns as to his competency.   Court makes record - the filed competency reports have come back as competent to stand trial.  Both atty's agree.  Atty Reid makes further stmt to the court he has been in contact with his client.  Court addressed Mr. White.  Mr. White wishes to have his attorney address it for him.  Court advised him he wants to hear it from him.  DE states as far as right now yes he feels he is competent.  State addressed the Court as to letter from DE requesting Atty Reid be taken off the case.  Court addressed Atty Reid as to setting jury trial dates.   Atty Reid addressed the court not looking to set jury today but is requesting a status conference be set.  Court makes stmt - will be about 3 day trial.   Court is setting jury trial 4/10/18, 4/11/18 and 4/12/18 -  FPT also set.  Jury trial scheduled for April 10, 2019 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 26, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Richard Allen White in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant Richard Allen White in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  11:00 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State addressed the Court main question is whether the defense is going to have the 2nd evaluation.  Court makes stmt.  State addressed the Court further. Court makes stmt as to length of time in custody and competency evaluations.   Atty Reid addressed the Court he obtain the case yesterday - is requesting another evaluation - requests substitution of Judge.  State makes stmt requests court deny the DE's request for substitution.  Court denies the request for substitution of Judge not timely made.  Court further addressed Atty Reid.  State makes further arguement state is no longer looking at a misd. disposition.  Court makes stmt previously there was a plea to a misd. now it is a class E felony being prosecuted.  Atty Reid will be contacting another evaluator for competency exam.  Court if that DR says he is competent court will set for trial as quickly as possible. Court 3 day jury trial after Christmas.  Competency hearing scheduled for November 26, 2018 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Richard Allen White in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Richard Allen White in custody.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to amend counts 2 and 3 to 940.225(3m) on each.  Court grants motion to amend counts 2 and 3.  Defendant entered plea of no contest to counts 2,3 and 4.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 2, 3 and 4 and counts 1, 5, 6 and 7 are dismissed and read-in.  

COURT:  Count 2 : - Sentence w/held probation 4 years - 9 months county jail credit 113 days time served  - costs of $443.00 - AODA and any follow thru - No contact with Jessica Rought, Louise Rought there residence or F.N.T dob: 6/12/01 - no contact with any one under the age of 18 - to complete a psycho sexual evaluation - absolute sobriety - any counseling DOC may impose - DE is to agree to an restraining order brought before him from Jessica Rought or FNT -  Restitution held open -  counts 1, 5, 6 and 7 are dismissed and read-in

Count 3:   Sentence w/held probation 4 years - 9 months county jail consecutive to count 2 - costs of $443.00 - AODA and any follow thru - No contact with Jessica Rought  Louise Rought there residence or  F.N.T dob: 6/12/01 - no contact with any one under the age of 18 - to complete a psycho sexual evaluation - absolute sobriety - DE is to agree to an restraining order brought before him from Jessica Rought or FNT -  Restitutuion held open - counts 1, 5, 6 and 7 are dismissed and read-in.

Count 4: 3 years 6 months prison STAYED pending successfull completion of probation in counts 2 and 3 - 18 months confinement and 2 years extended supervision - costs of $518.00  - consecutive to counts 2 and 3
